intro: Verbascum urumiense, commonly known as the Urumie mullein, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, fuzzy leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Verbascum urumiense is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used traditionally in some regions for its medicinal properties.
